titleStmt.title: William Goriss et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9055

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency
James F. Robinson

We your petitioners whose names are hereunto signed knowing Peter Wilkins to be a poor man and man of a family, and disposed to follow the ways of honesty would respectfully ask that the fine assessed against him in the case herewith transmitted be remitted, he not knowing at the time of the commission of the offense that he was doing any act in violation of Law --

Wm Goriss
W F Swift
J C Calhoun
W F Norton
J, G, Fisher
Geo Smedly
J W Brom
A L Jones
Wm, W, Herndon
John P Hart
E, R, Hart
G. W. Ratcliffe
John Q. A King
G. F Rabb
D A Given
